    • Method Detail

      • transform

        org.apache.commons.math3.complex.Complex[][] transform(double[][] input_array,
                                                       org.apache.commons.math3.transform.DftNormalization norm_type)
        A method to carry out a two-dimensional forward Fourier transform.

        The frequency scale of the resulting transform can be calculated using:

        freq_inc_i [per mm] = 1.0 / (total width of input array [mm]);

        freq_inc_j [per mm] = 1.0 / (total height of input array [mm]);
        Parameters:
        input_array - A two-dimensional array of double-precision values. The length of each array dimension must be a power of two
        norm_type - The type of normalisation to carry out. Can be DftNormalization.STANDARD or DftNormalization.UNITARY.
        Returns:
        A two-dimensional array of complex numbers containing the result of the forward Fourier transform. The return array has the same dimensions as the input array.

      • transform

        org.apache.commons.math3.complex.Complex[][] transform(org.apache.commons.math3.complex.Complex[][] input_array,
                                                       org.apache.commons.math3.transform.DftNormalization norm_type,
                                                       org.apache.commons.math3.transform.TransformType trans_type)
        A method to carry out a two-dimensional forward or reverse Fourier transform.
        Parameters:
        input_array - A two-dimensional Complex array of values. The length of each array dimension must be a power of two
        norm_type - The type of normalisation to carry out. Can be DftNormalization.STANDARD or DftNormalization.UNITARY.
        trans_type - TransformType.INVERSE or TransformType.FORWARD
        Returns:
        A two-dimensional array of complex numbers containing the result of the Fourier transform. The return array has the same dimensions as the input array.

      • transform

        org.apache.commons.math3.complex.Complex[][] transform(double[][] input_array,
                                                       org.apache.commons.math3.transform.DftNormalization norm_type,
                                                       org.apache.commons.math3.transform.TransformType trans_type)
        A method to carry out a two-dimensional forward or reverse Fourier transform.
        Parameters:
        input_array - A two-dimensional double array of values. The length of each array dimension must be a power of two
        norm_type - The type of normalisation to carry out. Can be DftNormalization.STANDARD or DftNormalization.UNITARY.
        trans_type - TransformType.INVERSE or TransformType.FORWARD
        Returns:
        A two-dimensional array of complex numbers containing the result of the Fourier transform. The return array has the same dimensions as the input array.

      • swapQuadrants

        org.apache.commons.math3.complex.Complex[][] swapQuadrants(org.apache.commons.math3.complex.Complex[][] input_array)
        Method to swap the quadrants of a two dimensional frequency domain array that is the result of a 2d Fourier transform of an image.
        Parameters:
        input_array - Array of frequency data with zero frequency at 0,0
        Returns:
        Array of frequency data with zero frequency at the centre

      • swapQuadrants

        double[][] swapQuadrants(double[][] input_array)
        Method to swap the quadrants of a two dimensional frequency domain array that is the result of a 2d Fourier transform of an image.
        Parameters:
        input_array - Array of frequency data with zero frequency at 0,0
        Returns:
        Array of frequency data with zero frequency at the centre

      • transpose

        private org.apache.commons.math3.complex.Complex[][] transpose(org.apache.commons.math3.complex.Complex[][] input)
        Method to transpose a 2d array of complex numbers: the row and column indices are swapped. 
            1   2   3   4    Transpose       1   5   9  13
    5   6   7   8    moves between   2   6  10  14
    9  10  11  12    these two       3   7  11  15
   13  14  15  16    arrays          4   8  12  16
        Parameters:
        input - A two-dimensional array of complex numbers
        Returns:
        The transpose of the input, also a two-dimensional array of complex numbers

      • transpose

        private double[][] transpose(double[][] input)
        Method to transpose a 2d double array of numbers: the row and column indices are swapped. 
            1   2   3   4    Transpose       1   5   9  13
    5   6   7   8    moves between   2   6  10  14
    9  10  11  12    these two       3   7  11  15
   13  14  15  16    arrays          4   8  12  16
        Parameters:
        input - A two-dimensional double array of numbers
        Returns:
        The transpose of the input, also a two-dimensional array of complex numbers
